 3.1 - READABLE
LANGUAGE OF PARTS(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

The human language of each passage or phrase in the content can be
programmatically determined except for proper names, technical terms, words of
indeterminate language, and words or phrases that have become part of the
vernacular of the immediately surrounding text. 

These websites...

Make text content readable and understandable.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Alternative language links 

An HTML Web page includes links to versions of the page in other languages
(e.g., Deutsch, Fran√ßais, Nederlands, Castellano, etc.). The text of each link
is the name of the language, in that language. The language of each link is
indicated via a lang attribute. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/language-of-parts.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
